p: There are many variations to the organizational structure of randomized clinical trials but most have similar components; a sponsor/funder, a steering committee or executive committee, a data coordinating center, a statistical center, clinical sites for participant recruitment, various laboratories needed for participant assessment, perhaps adjudication committees to classify clinical events, and a DMC [ [1], [2], [3], [4], [5]] This basic structure has been in place and used successfully for over 4Â decades. There are many examples of such success in a variety of disease entities that have been shared [ 2].
